title: [Large-scale] Practice-Centered Problem-Solving Intensive Programming Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Computer Literacy and Logical Reasoning Experience
context.additional_context: Small-group settings enabling personalized feedback, emphasizing practice-based on real-world cases

learning_goals: Analyze given practical problems and convert them into pseudocode.
Implement and debug simple algorithms using the Python programming language.

In 3–4 person teams, learners document a 5-step logical process (problem definition, hypothesis setting, experiment design, result analysis, conclusion) to solve a given science problem (e.g., environmental pollution data analysis), and create presentation materials that meet ≥80% of criteria in peer evaluation and instructor feedback after a 10-minute presentation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
